Package org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.data

Interface AsyncDataProvider.LoadListener

  • Enclosing class:
    AsyncDataProvider<T>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface AsyncDataProvider.LoadListener
    Listener interface for notifications about AsyncDataProvider asynchronous load attempts.

    AsyncDataProvider guarantees "proper" ordering of notifications:

    • Exactly one STARTED notification and one COMPLETED, CANCELED, or FAILED notification is delivered for each task.
    • STARTED notifications are always delivered before the corresponding COMPLETED, CANCELED, or FAILED notification for the same task.
    • The COMPLETED, CANCELED, or FAILED notification for a task is always delivered before the STARTED notification for the next task.
    • Notifications are delivered for tasks in the same order that the tasks were started (by invoking AsyncDataProvider#load.load()).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int CANCELED
      Status value indicating that async loading was cancel()'ed, and that its results (if any) were not applied.
      static int COMPLETED
      Status value indicating that async loading successfully completed.
      static int FAILED
      Status value indicating that async loading failed.
      static int STARTED
      Status value indicating that async loading has started.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void handleLoadingStatusChange​(long id, int status, Throwable error)
      Receive notification that asynchronous loading has either started, completed, been canceled, or failed.

    • Method Detail

      • handleLoadingStatusChange

        void handleLoadingStatusChange​(long id,
                               int status,
                               Throwable error)
        Receive notification that asynchronous loading has either started, completed, been canceled, or failed.
        Parameters:
        id - unique ID for this async load attempt
        status - async load status
        error - exception if status is FAILED, otherwise null
